poem:
Title: "In the Colorful Shadow of Frida"

In the falling rain of the critic's words, 
she remains undenting, a cast-iron flower,
lost in the echoes of her own canvas veins.
Smudged lipstick and defiant brows,
a tale retold, blurred by mortal hands.
Yet, her spirit lives on,
In painted whispers and thorny thoughts,
as Frida, infinitely paints herself, onto the timeless parchment of eternity.
